did.head: Descriptive Summary

repository.label: Repository
repository.corpname: David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University

origination.label: Creator

did.unittitle: German Broadside collection 1905-1990 and undated, bulk 1920s
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The German Broadside Collection spans the years 1905-1990, with the majority of items dating from the 1920s. Formats include broadsides, leaflets, handbills, campaign publications, political brochures, propaganda posters, and other ephemera documenting the political, economic, and social conditions in Germany, Eastern Europe, Russia, and China, particularly during the Weimar Republic. Many of the broadsides relate to elections during the 1920s and the legacy of World War I as well as the political implications of women's suffrage during that time. Political parties represented include the Socialist Party, the Communist Party, the German Democratic Party, and the German National People's Party, as well as several smaller parties. The broadsides come from cities across Germany, with Leipzig and Berlin strongly represented. Additional materials include Allied propaganda leaflets and Holocaust exhibition posters, as well as materials relating to the assassination of German Foreign Minister Walther Rathenau in 1922.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], German Broadside Collection, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The German Broadside Collection was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 1948.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Paula Jeannet Mangiafico and Willeke Sandler, January 2012
Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The German Broadside Collection spans the years 1905-1990. Though the majority of the items are in broadside or poster form, most dating from the 1920s, there are other formats in the collection, including leaflets, handbills, campaign publications, political brochures, and other ephemera; many of these items contain political cartoons and caricatures. The broadsides originated from cities across Germany, with Leipzig and Berlin strongly represented; the majority were disseminated by the Socialist Party, the Communist Party, the German Democratic Party, and the German National People's Party, with some material from the Center Party and from Richard Kunze's anti-Semitic German Social Party. The broadsides range in size from 5 x 3" to 37 x 27". The majority relate to the 1919 National Assembly election and the 1920 and 1924 Reichstag elections; these are arranged according to election, and within each election according to city. The broadsides address economic, political, and cultural themes debated in national, state, and local elections in the 1920s in Germany, as well as the legacy of the First World War.

Additional materials include broadsides relating to commemorations of the assassination of German Foreign Minister Walther Rathenau in 1922, the political situation in China, Poland, and Russia, among others, and international peace, workers, and anti-imperialism movements. The collection also includes three unaddressed letters from the Zentralkomitee Internationale Arbeiterhilfe about events in Hungary and China, and two sets of Holocaust exhibition posters produced by the Anti-Defamation League and the United States Holocaust Memorial Council in the late twentieth-century.

The collection provides rich documentation on the political climate in early twentieth-century Germany, especially during the Weimar Republic (1919-1933). It offers an expansive view of political life in Germany in a variety of cities and within a variety of political parties. The bulk of the material stems from 1919-1924 and from 1928-1930, both periods of political and economic instability. In the Weimar Republic, numerous political parties vied for German votes and materials in the collection document this competition. With the extension of suffrage to German women in 1919, political parties (especially the Socialist Party) began to tailor their election propaganda towards these new voters, as is reflected in numerous broadsides in this collection. Of note in the collection is the predominance of materials from Leipzig, two Käthe Kollwitz drawings, and the Reichsbund jüdischer Frontsoldaten broadside An die deutschen Mütter.

arrangement.head: Collection Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized into seven series: Allied Propaganda Leaflets, 1944 and undated; Campaign Publications and Political Brochures, 1919-1930 and undated; Elections, 1919-1933 and undated; Holocaust Exhibition Posters, undated; International Relations and Movements, 1900-1930 and undated; Walther Rathenau Assassination, 1922-1926; and Other Topics, undated.

controlaccess.head: Subject Headings
controlaccess.p: These are searchable subject entries for this collection. Performing a search on these subjects in the Duke University Libraries online catalog will bring up other related research materials.

separatedmaterial.head: Separated Material
separatedmaterial.p: The following items have been separated and relocated in the Currency Collection and the Postcard Collection: a piece of German currency (10 million Reichsmarks) from 1923, and a letter from Chicago to Leipzig with a fold-out accordion sheet of 19 labeled postcards of a parade/community event in the United States.

did.unittitle: Allied Propaganda Leaflets Series, 1944 and undated

scopecontent.p: Small leaflets produced by the Allied powers and distributed in Germany and Italy as propaganda targeting Axis military forces and civilian populations.

did.unittitle: Im Osten [...] Im Westen,1944, 2 copies
Safe Conduct, (2 copies)
Safe-Conduct (21st Army Group)

unittitle.title: Le général Eisenhower s'adresse au peuples des Pays Occupés

did.unittitle: Campaign Publications and Political Brochures Series, 1919-1924

scopecontent.p: Contains broadsides, leaflets, and handbills relating to local, state, and national elections, mostly from the Socialist Party and the German Democratic Party, with some material from other interest groups. They originated from German newspapers and election newspapers printed and distributed by political parties. Arranged chronologically.

did.unittitle: Flugschriften der Deutschen Demokratischen Partei. Staat und Kirche (Leipzig, circa 1919)
Leitsätze der Deutschen Demokratischen Partei für Leipzig und Umgegend (Leipzig, 1919)
Wahlaufruf der Deutschen Demokratischen Partei (Leipzig, 1919)
Soll die evangelische Schule religionslos werden? (Berlin, 1919)
Was sind wir unserer evangelischen Kirche schuldig? (Berlin, 1919)
Ein Bekenntnis zu Demokratie, Republik und Volksgemeinschaft (German Democratic Party, 1924)
Die Amerikafahrt des L.Z. 126, ein Erfolg demokratischer Politik! (German Democratic Party, Stuttgart, 1924)
Raus die Gefangenen! (Socialist Party, Berlin, 1924)
Arbeitskolleginnen und Arbeitskollegen! (German Democratic Party)
In das amtliche Wahlkuvert muß der mit gleichen Aufdruck versehene Stimmezettel gesteckt werden (Socialist Party)
Elections Series, 1919-1933 and undated

scopecontent.p: The largest group in the collection. Contains electioneering broadsides targeting the general population, political party members, and interest groups such as women, blue- and white-collar workers, Catholics, students, and farmers. The broadsides are predominantly small leaflets printed with political slogans and party platforms, announcements of rallies, and instructions to voters either on one or both sides. Arranged according to election, then by city, then by political party.

scopecontent.p: Consists of two sets of large black-and-white and color posters produced by the Anti-Defamation League of B'nai B'rith and the United States Holocaust Memorial Council.

International Relations and Movements Series, 1900-1930 and undated

scopecontent.p: Materials in this series deal with a range of international movements such as those centered on anti-imperialism, workers, and peace, as well as the political situation in foreign countries, including China, Czechoslovakia, Hungary, Poland, and Russia. The series also includes three unaddressed letters from the Zentralkomitee Internationale Arbeiterhilfe about events in Hungary and China. The broadsides consist of publicity for lectures and rallies, posters, and informational handbills. Large posters in this series are found in the Oversize Folder. Arranged in alphabetical order by topic or geographical area.

did.unittitle: Anti-Imperialism, Worker, and Peace Movements Subseries, 1920-1927 and undated

Walther Rathenau Assassination Series, 1922-1926

scopecontent.p: Contains materials relating to the assassination of the German Foreign Minister Walther Rathenau by German nationalists on June 24, 1922, as well as commemorations of the event in 1925 and 1926.

did.unittitle: Eine sensationelle Entdeckung im Rathenau-Mordprozeß Sonderblatt Neue Leipziger Zeitung (October 7, 1922)

unittitle.emph: Revolutions-Urkunde-Sammlung vom 7.11.1918-30.6.1919 (Urkunden zur Geschichtsschreibung) bestehend aus seltenen Maueranschlägen, Plakaten, Flugzetten, Broschüren, Lichtbildaufnahmen u.s.w.

scopecontent.p: Red bound volume of unknown provenance containing an index of broadsides, posters, leaflets, and brochures relating to the revolution in Germany (in particular in Berlin) between November 1918 and June 1919. Does not correspond to material in this collection.
